def: A piece or fragment of a broken pot. Job ii. 8.
The seventh ecclesiastical mode, whose scale commences on G.
To spend; to squander. See Dispend. [Obs.]Some noble men in Spain can despend Howell.

Of or pertaining to the will; subject to, or regulated by, thewill; as, the voluntary motions of an animal, such as the movementsof the leg or arm (in distinction from involuntary motions, such asthe movements of the heart); the voluntary muscle fibers, which arethe agents in voluntary motion.
The derivation of the name of a race, tribe, etc., from that ofa fabulous hero, progenitor, etc.
Round and without a cella; consisting of a single ring ofcolumns supporting a roof; -- said esp. of a temple.
A Whig; -- a cant term applied in contempt to ScotchPresbyterians. [Scot.] Sir W. Scott.
A high, steep rock; a precipice. Cliff swallow (Zo√∂l.), a NorthAmerican swallow (Petrochelidon lunifrons), which builds its nestagainst cliffs; the eaves swallow.
Pertaining to, produced by, or of the nature of, magistery. SeeMagistery, 2.
